participant_1.name: Emily
participant_1.personality: Optimistic and outgoing, she enjoys music and values friendships.
participant_1.background: I am going to start school at the university of Kentucky. I have been in band all four years of high school. I have 2 brothers. I am a senior in high school.

participant_2.name: Jordan
participant_2.personality: Supportive and reflective, they are currently facing challenges but remain hopeful about the future.
participant_2.background: I think I might need help. I just lost my job and I am looking for something new. I live with my parents. I am bisexual.

content.text: Hey! I'm going to start school at the University of Kentucky in the fall. I'm really excited about it!
Congratulations! That's great news. I hope you have a wonderful time there.
Thanks! I'm sure I will. I've been in band all four years of high school, and I'm looking forward to continuing that in college.
That's awesome! I'm sure you'll be great at it.
Thanks! I hope so. I'm also looking forward to meeting new people and making new friends.
That's always fun. I'm sure you'll make a lot of friends at Kentucky.
I hope so. I'm also a little nervous about starting college. I'm not sure what to expect.
That's understandable. College can be a lot different than high school. But don't worry, you'll figure it out.
So, what are you planning to study in college?
I'm not sure yet. I'm thinking about majoring in business or accounting.
Those are both good choices. I'm sure you'll do great at whatever you choose to do.
Thanks! I hope so. I'm also looking forward to living on campus. I've never lived away from home before, so I'm a little nervous about that, but I'm also excited.
That's understandable. Living on campus can be a lot of fun, but it can also be challenging. But I'm sure you'll do great.
